intro: Dichapetalum jabassense, commonly known as the Congo bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
